website_summaries.verdict: Forget the aux cord -- this Logitech Bluetooth Music Receiver is the easiest way to stream audio from your smartphone or laptop.
pros: The Logitech Bluetooth Music Receiver streams audio from nearly any mobile device to any stereo or powered speakers with an open input
It's easy to connect via either 3.5mm or RCA and you can link multiple devices to it at once
The wireless range extends up to 50 feet (15 meters) away and it holds a strong connection within reasonable distance
cons: The Chromecast Audio offers better sound quality and multiroom options via Wi-Fi, making it a better option for Android users

customer_reviews.title: Use your old amp and Speakers and listen to MP3's
customer_reviews.text: This unit has RCA holes...that means instead of hooking up a cd player or tape deck...you hook this up to the back of your receiver...then pair it to your phone's music player and Jam!...I had a thousand dollars worth of old gear in the garage and it wasn't being used...this works great...hope this helps some old school folks that don't know you can do this...sounds so much better than most of the crappy little wireless speakers the kids are buying..
customer_reviews.author: Black Creek Joe

customer_reviews.title: BEEPS BEEPS BEEPS
customer_reviews.text: when something is disconnected or connecting without you noticing it will make a loud series of 3 beeps about 10 or 15 seconds apart from eachother waking you up at 3am wondering what the hell is going on. returning. Why is it so hard for the people that make these to add the option to turn the sound off?
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Dan

customer_reviews.title: Recently like another reviewer suggested
customer_reviews.text: I've had this adapter for some time now and used it for connecting my phone to a non-bluetooth audio system to play Pandora. It works perfectly. Recently like another reviewer suggested, I am using it in my car, connected through my car radio's aux plug. One paired to the phone, it pairs automatically as soon as it powers up. I power the unit from a typical 12v dc to 5v usb lighter adaper. I use a usb to 1.7mm cable also from amazon (Onite 2 PCS Electronics USB / DC Plugs & Adapters Power Cables (USB to 4.0x1.7mm). All is very well and I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Gadgetman

customer_reviews.title: Easy and excellent solution to connect an older stereo system to stream music by bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: This is a brilliant product, that installed quickly and was as close to "plug and play" as it gets. Bought the adapter to solve the problem of hooking up an older stereo receiver and speakers to bluetooth, in order to stream music. Several years ago, had bought an Apple Airport Express to solve the same problem (by wifi, not bluetooth), but that was cumbersome to set up and never worked reliably. This adapter was set up in 5-10 minutes, and connected easily to devices by bluetooth. Sound quality is excellent (you wouldn't know it is a bluetooth connection). Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: J Morel

customer_reviews.title: Way to loud
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what is going on, but i use this bluetooth adaptor to connect my phone to some outdoor speakers, and even on the lowest volume setting, the music is super loud, I tried two other phone (different brands as well) and they still cannot get the volume down... its basically mute, or blasting loud music...??? I bought this because it was Logitech, usually great products, not sure why this is happening...??
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Small with Big Sound, highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a year ago, just set up with Bose AM5 speakers I bought almost 10 years ago, I'm quite blown away by the sound of my new sound setup, connection was instant with this tiny little device with extremely big sound. I studied sound and work in audio for a living, and I can tell you this device is very good, the stereo image is very apparent and clear, playing MP3 music from my phone gives some pretty good sound, I can't wait to try lossless with this!
customer_reviews.author: Olukunle

customer_reviews.title: This is an incredible little box!
customer_reviews.text: This device is the size of a matchbox. But it sure delivers awesome sound. I've been looking for a Bluetooth device to connect to my traditional stereo system. I'd been using a Mac mini for the past 9 years. Which has worked well. With this little box I can now make my music selections from my iPad. A much more convenient arrangement. I looked at many of the other devices offered both on Amazon and Ebay, I even added Harman Kardon BTA 10 Bluetooth Wireless Adapter to my Wishlist. But at half the cost the Logitech Bluetooth Audio Adapter won me over. You're going to love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Hoosier Reader

customer_reviews.title: Works very well. All you need, and inexpensive.
customer_reviews.text: You can run around and read all the reviews, and hear from the audiophiles about how you must have a $200 device, and all the numbers and nonsense, and wring your hands, and ask "I wonder if I should wait..." or you can buy this inexpensive device, made by a company that makes nothing badly as far as I can tell, and get great quality streaming music out of your old stereo system (or powered speakers) with no hassle at all. There is nothing else you can buy for $20 that will turn you on like this gadget.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Dee

customer_reviews.title: Great price and easy to set up!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second of these I have bought. They are very easy to set up - plug in the power cable, attach the RCA to 3.5 jack, press the button to make it searchable and connect you wireless device. Makes connecting a mobile device to an older system super easy, to set up, connect, and use. Best $20 I have spent on stereo equipment in a long time!
customer_reviews.author: KC_Amazon_Fan

customer_reviews.title: It works fine and lets me play out iTunes through my vintage stereo system
customer_reviews.text: I have a 1980s era stereo amplifier with hookups for phono, CD player, video, etc. I plugged this into one of the free hookups and it works fine to play out music through my stereo system (with big old time speakers) from my iPhone or MacBook. The only problem is that you need to unplug it (from the electricity) when you're playing music from some other medium such as a CD or LP; the unit generates some kind of interference that causes sound distortion. Once it's unplugged this immediately disappears. Also note: This unit needs to be plugged in, so plan for that if you're going to use it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Decker

customer_reviews.title: Thought it was dead out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: Well the first time I plugged it in it worked great. Then when I went to go use it the next day the LED was flickering weird and it wouldn't work. Couldn't get it to work period. Fast forward a couple months and I grab it out of the junk pile and play with it, turns out it was the power supply gone bad out the box. I clipped the power cable and wired it to a USB cord(the supply was 5V DC) and it works yet again!
customer_reviews.author: purdyboy89

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic little bluetooth receiver.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic little bluetooth receiver. I use it in my shop, and I can walk all around the shop, behind large equipment, and the sound doesn't drop out. I can easily get about 30 feet away from the unit and the music still plays, haven't tried farther because that maxes out my shop space. Can't get much range outside of the shop, metal building, so that is to be expected. Sound is good for bluetooth, set up was simple, and I plugged it into the power controlled by my AV receiver so when I turn on the receiver, it turns on, and when I turn off the receiver, it turns off.
customer_reviews.author: fishie20

customer_reviews.title: Super Easy/High Quality but Limited Output Options
customer_reviews.text: Given the lower than 5-star review I want to stress that this is a great product. Well designed, extremely easy to use, and great value for the money. Audiophiles should note that it has only RCA output jacks and an auxiliary cord jack for output connection to other devices. There's no optical digital or digital coaxial output, so you will be able to connect this to a DAC or to your receiver's digital ports through anything other than RCA. That said, this is an impressive device, with great build quality, and connectivity, that will probably work just fine for the vast majority of users who are just trying to hook up a pair of speakers at the pool or something.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smart plug and Logi will upgraded dated speaker system
customer_reviews.text: It is a very good Bluetooth add on to my dated speaker system. I bought a smart plug for this Logi, I turn off when not needed. The system remembers my phone and auto connect when I turn it on. Sound quality is very good too. So I don’t have any problems like others mentioned this device will take over Bluetooth connection as it has very strong Bluetooth and needed to forget device on phone to not to connect always. I just turn off using smart plug app when I don’t need it. This and smart plug upgraded my dated device close to the latest one😊.
customer_reviews.author: Sas

customer_reviews.title: Excellent range and "lock-in"
customer_reviews.text: I've got a couple of these but I mainly use it on my boat, which is pretty large and sometimes had a lot of people on it. BlueTooth is a finicky mistress. Great tool but one tech guy said "Bluetooth is like having your dog out in the back yard and your one on and and your wife is on the other - both saying "Come Here Girl". The obedient doggy wants to please both masters but night not do either. This Logitech "locks" quickly and absolutely works like a hose if it's just us on the boat. In a party situation with 15 or 20 other cell phones.... that's asking a lot of any Bluetooth device.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Potter

customer_reviews.title: Everyone is now a DJ
customer_reviews.text: This Bluetooth is the life of the party. Everyone wants to share their music and like a good DJ who plays all genres of music the parties never gets boring. So far no one at the parties have had any troubles connecting with iPhone, Samsung or LG phones. As long as your system has an AUX Input you're set. I have a old but very power receiver that I use outside for the pool deck and it works great with the Bluetooth. I didn't have to spend hundreds of dollars on a new radio. Just select your music on your phone and control the volume from your phone without ever having to touch the radio. Everyone loves it.
customer_reviews.author: inspector gadget 007

customer_reviews.title: Has one major annoyance
customer_reviews.text: It works with one major annoyance. It doesn't allow you to disconnect. It's auto reconnect is basically mandatory connection when in range. I had my phone paired with this so I could listen to my music over the home stereo and it works likes it suppose to, but when I hit disconnect under my Bluetooth options on the phone, it automatically reconnected. It hijacked my phone and would not allow me to disconnect until I selected "Forget This Device". Since it doesn't have an on/off switch, I will have to either unplug it or pair it every time I want to use it with my phone, which is what makes it highly annoying.
customer_reviews.author: T Baran

customer_reviews.title: functional, but quirky
customer_reviews.text: Using to add Bluetooth connectivity to an existing amplified 2.1 loudspeaker system. The Logitech adapter puts out a full volume tone when connecting, which can be annoying when first awakening or during a romantic evening. It often says that it connected when not, forcing the need to turn phone Bluetooth off, then on, to connect. At times, I will have an alternate Bluetooth device connected, then the Logitech decides to take over and I lose connectivity to the other connected device. It works well, has long range communications, but need to work around the quirkiness.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Previty

customer_reviews.title: I Like It, But ...
customer_reviews.text: The unit works well, connects easily to 2 devices, and is fairly small and unobtrusive. The main problem I have with it is no power button. If you walk in the room where the Logitech is (or get within range) with a paired phone it automatically connects to the unit. If your stereo is not on at the time, you won't hear any of your phone's alert sounds - cause they are going through the Bluetooth connection. There are several workarounds to be sure, but it's a design problem that shouldn't exist.
customer_reviews.author: Delta 13

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work through exterior walls very good.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to go with my Wolverine wireless system. I wanted to be able to have my phone with me and still play music on the system (you have to plug the phone into the base to play music). I plugged this into the Wolverine base and it works good when I’m in the house, but struggles outside (through walls). I had it on my bed stand and we were just on the other side of the wall at the pool and it was cutting out if I moved more than 15 feet from the wall. However, in the house it worked everywhere I went. Not the answer I had in mind, but it did kind of work.
customer_reviews.author: Madtown

customer_reviews.title: Simple and efficient
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great product to use for home theater system. I have an old receiver/amp. I have very nice speaker, just older. With TVs now usually eliminating lots of wires, Bluetooth is the only remedy for sound. Simple plug and play. Can be used with a simple Jack for computer speakers or with a second input with the red/white cables. Good simple product There is another version that is not Logitech. Might be the exact same, I just trust this brand. So for the extra few bucks, makes me feel safer...
customer_reviews.author: M.R

customer_reviews.title: Cannot adjust volume
customer_reviews.text: This Logitech Bluetooth Adapter paired just fine with my computer, but I am unable to adjust the volume. The audio volume is the same regardless of what I set the volume mixer on my Windows 10 notebook. I posted on the Logitech community forum and I reached out to their tech support, but I did not receive a response. I am going to return it if I am unable to get it working correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Dissonance

customer_reviews.title: Great update to my stereo system!
customer_reviews.text: I have only one component plugged into my home stereo now. I have attempted to connect it to my Amazon Echo Show5 but it doesn't seem to connect(4stars). That could be a version issue with this Bluetooth. I have not asked Tech Support yet but I will update if I get a positive result. Another connectivity issue I have is getting it to automatically recognize my phone. Sometimes I have to tap the pairing button on top of the Logitech but I assume that is to be expected for my phone that has about eight saved devices. Overall I am pleased with this Bluetooth Device and it does what I need it to do.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: How can it be so simple? ....duh is logitech
customer_reviews.text: Ok long story short, my stpedad wanted to used a power speaker that only had red/white rca plugs line in everything else was mic or usb and was bugging me to figure how to use his phone on it. 1 mins after this little gadget was already getting ready to be shippep. Setup is the simpliest thing ever. 2 cables: one power adapter and one headphone to rca plug into speaker plug into power, go to the phone bluetooth find logitech and bam!! U listening to ur phone on any speaker. Keep in mind speaker or amplifier must hace rca jacks or 3.5mm headphones jack. Now music is blasting everytime im visiting. I think i made a mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Sigfredo Gomez

customer_reviews.title: If you are looking for a tech solution that is fair priced and good quality I would recommend Logitech products
customer_reviews.text: I have always been partial to Logitech products. This is no exception. It works as described. If you are looking for a tech solution that is fair priced and good quality I would recommend Logitech products. Seems to connect well to my cell phone and I can stream my music at will. Also it works really well with my Logitech Speakers (also purchased at the same time as a combo) Modem Z323.
customer_reviews.author: Israel

customer_reviews.title: Prefect Adapter for Streaming Music from our Tablet or Phone to our analog A/V equipment
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect in our 5th wheel allowing me to wirelessly connect and stream music from my phone or tablet to the analog receiver in our RV. I can control the music from my easy chair inside or outside of our unit. My tablet or phone connects perfectly each time I enable blue tooth on the host device. The initial set-up was a breeze. The reception provides just enough distance to control the music outside the unit, which is about 20-feet through the aluminum walls of the RV trailer.
customer_reviews.author: TAH_Asheville

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Needed
customer_reviews.text: I paired this little gem to my Alexa, so that when I asked Alexa to turn on my stereo (used mini smart plug for on/off), she automatically comes on through the stereo. I can stream my music seamlessly thank to this device, and the music sounds great. Tell Alexa to turn the stereo off, and it is back to Alexa only. Simple to use with a push of a button to pair. Connect the device via RCA or auxiliary jack; it even includes a cable that can be used to connect RCA to plug and vice-versa. The biggest benefit for my installation is that it is A/C powered. Logitech has delivered on this with simplicity and reliability.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Retains BT sound quality while updating analog hardware.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to bring my Pioneer VSX home stereo up to modern standards. I was expecting clipping or some time of sound quality drop off. So far its worked out ok, The device fits in the palm of your hand, connections are very straight forward. they provide power supply, 3.5mm to RCA R/L. You can walk a fair distance away from the device before you BT signal drops. I would highly recommend this to anyone looking to bring that ol' stereo back to life with your online music account. One thing to note this is 2.1 sound with no signal processing.
customer_reviews.author: Payo

customer_reviews.title: Horrible. Absolutely horrible.
customer_reviews.text: I'm writing this on my LG V20, in bed, with my Bluetooth receiver 5 feet away, on the dresser, with line of sight. Every 5-10 seconds I am being entertained by the audio chime of this piece of &@+$ disconnecting and reconnecting.
customer_reviews.author: Edward C

customer_reviews.title: Can't disconnect from Bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: Once you've connected your phone to this device these are the only two ways to disconnect: 1) Unplug (remove power) from the audio adapter. 2) Forget/Unpair the audio adapter entirely from your phone. (I haven't tried this, I'm assuming this would work, it may not) It's problematic that you cannot just disconnect from the audio adapter when you're done using it. If you do, the audio adapter will aggressively and repeatedly re-connect to your phone until you kill the power to the device.
customer_reviews.author: John Aquilano

customer_reviews.title: Does its job, good quality
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for 3 years now and it still works like when I first bought it. Sound quality is great and it will stay connected when I'm in the other room. Yes it does automatically connect to my phone once I'm within ~20 feet of the device which, for me, works out really well and its ready to go once I'm inside. I do have other bluetooth headphones I like to use around the house and although sometimes this device will compete for the connection, usually there are no problems. Worth the money in my book
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to be disconnected
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. I had an older Logitech adaptor before that after the initial pairing, it can be manually connected or disconnected from my iPhone. It worked great and I really liked it. This newer one however, after the initial paring, automatically connects to my iPhone whenever it’s in range. I can’t even disconnect it from my iPhone. The only way to disconnect is to turn off my iPhone’s Bluetooth. I personally don’t like this feature, but I can see how some people may like it better this way.
customer_reviews.author: keyman

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade for the corded stereo!
customer_reviews.text: It's a game changer when you stop having to physically plug your phone into your sound system. I decided to try this and as per usual, Logitech didn't fail me. I actually used this to enable Bluetooth on an old Logitech sound system. I'm sure this will last just as long as the speakers I hooked it up to. It requires power and the headphone jack input, so make sure you have a plugin where you want to use it. Thanks for an awesome product :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Auto Connect Annoying
customer_reviews.text: Once paired, it auto connects no matter what and takes over the device (phone) whenever you're in range and no settings to change it. You have to unplug the device or select "forget" (disconnect does not work, it will automatically pair again) on your device and re-pair it when you wish to use it again. Bummed I threw the box away yesterday because I'd send it back and find one that works properly. In the Q&A this was addressed, but I didn't read it until I had the issue and honestly, I assumed I'd be able to disconnect it like EVERY other bluetooth device since the beginning of bluetooth.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: Solution to Aggressive Bluetooth Pairing Problem.
customer_reviews.text: It works well and pairs easily but usable range seems less than the 50 feet line of sight and less than 30 feet thru wall. The problem many have talked about is that it maintains bluetooth pairing even when not using it, so you can't hear Alexa or your phone (ring and speaker). The way I worked around this, was to use a smart outlet for this device ()and have Alexa control it. So when I tell Alexa to turn on my bluetooth audio, she turns on my sound system to the correct port as well as the outlet that powers this device. Then I can choose what music to play and whether thru Alexa or my phone.
customer_reviews.author: The Doctor

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME product and shipped fast
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME product and shipped fast. I bought this item to connect a TV to an audio receiver. the TV is mounted above a fireplace and has no audio lines running to where the receiver is located. the TV is a 4k Samsung Smart TV. I pressed the pairing button on the adapter and selected the device within the TV bluetooth settings. the adapter paired successfully. there was no audio delay, the sound was clean and loud. i bought one for myself and my mother-n-law. if i know of anyone else that needs this kind of setup will definitely send them this way. Great buy!!!!! If i get a chance i will take pics
customer_reviews.author: Kory

customer_reviews.title: Works well right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: I have an old Sansui quadraphonic stereo that I purchased while in the USNavy in 1972. I use it in my place of business. I wanted to listen to music from my iphone and had to plug it in before I got this audio adapter. The Sansui has a switchable 120 outlet so the adapter is powered from it. It works well although it sounds a little tinny on the high end, but it might just be the phone doing that. I am happy to be wireless and to be able to keep the Sansui Amplifier working for me.
customer_reviews.author: DSP

customer_reviews.title: Save for few hundred dollars
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my husband, wanna get a new set of Bose speaker, the cheapest one with Bluetooth same quality cost $600+ Then I comes up to use the old one ( the picture shown) I have to add this become a Bluetooth speaker. Save me a lot of money and the sound quality are as good as playing from computer or directly using 3.5mm jack. Don’t even have buy a audio line, it comes with it the 2 color audio line into 3.5mm save me another few bucks. Great gift 🎁 he said the best gift in this few year 😉😉😉 I think I can connected with Alexa, but haven’t done it yet 😆😆
customer_reviews.author: Tammy C

customer_reviews.title: Provides an easy way to pair with non-Bluetooth speakers.
customer_reviews.text: It took me longer to open the box than it took to connect this Bluetooth adapter to my Logitech speaker system. The 3.5 inch plug from the speaker plugged directly into the Bluetooth adapter. This option is not shown on the instruction pamphlet, but is obvious. The power adapter was in the box and easy to attach. To pair with my android tablet, I just pressed the Bluetooth button on the top of the adapter and searched for Bluetooth devices on the tablet. The device shows up as Logitech BT Adapter. It paired quickly and solidly.
customer_reviews.author: woodstrapper

customer_reviews.title: Super easy, works great
customer_reviews.text: This thing was surprisingly easy to use and set up. Simply plug it in, press the only button, and then add the device on your phone in the Bluetooth settings. Brain dead setup and works awesome. My dad was going to buy a smaller, crappy or Bluetooth speaker for his shop... Instead of using the existing Wi-Fi set up that is much greater quality. Getting this instead of a Bluetooth speaker means he can use the high quality speakers & receiver. Win! Definitely recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Global Chillage

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: This was so we could stream music from our device to the sound system we bought. It works. Once the phone is paired, if the sound system is on- but we don't have sound coming from anything- you can hear the bluetooth pairing pinging. It's not a loud tone, but after a few times it gets to you. So after we are done using the bluetooth, we unpair our device so it doesn't keep pinging whenever we aren't watching something on TV. Other than that. Sound quality great and super easy to pair.
customer_reviews.author: Darkskittlez23

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and sound. One big flaw IMO.
customer_reviews.text: The product works great. Very easy to connect to and blends right in with my set up. My ONLY gripe with this product is enough to make me rate it 3 stars...this NEEDS an on/off button. You will connect automatically every time you come close which will leave you wondering where your audio is if you’re not using your speakers so you have to either turn Bluetooth off on your phone or forget the device and re-pair every time...otherwise great sound and easy set up. PS. Someone please let me know if I somehow have never found the on/off button!
customer_reviews.author: LosDeff

customer_reviews.title: Works as promised
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if I would use this in an application calling for the "best" sound quality but it does a fine job between an older Yamaha A/V receiver and an Android phone or tablet. I am using the receiver to push a pair of outdoor patio speakers so a high quality sound reproduction isn't required. That said, it doesn't sound bad at all. It paired easily with both the phone and tablet with no drama. Can't speak to maximum range but it works well inside of ten feet.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: I had to see hooked up to my phone. I also have a Bluetooth headset that is connected to my phone. If you are within 30 ft of it it will kick off anything else you have connected to it. I find that quite annoying. So if you do buy this Make sure you have the device dedicated to it. Maybe a tablet or something. I know there are settings it can prioritize Bluetooth devices but that wasn't an option for me here. Other than that it's a pretty good device.
customer_reviews.author: S83t

customer_reviews.title: Turn off garbage over the air and get the good stuff online
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit to put my father's favorite type music into his office. There are no radio stations in my hometown that plays the music he likes, but by using this adapter attached to a Bose Wave he can stream online services which do play his favorite music. Connect it to your home computer and you too can listen to what you like and not what some programmer thinks you should like.
customer_reviews.author: R. Keith Clingan

customer_reviews.title: This works great. It’s lightweight and can be easily concealed and ...
customer_reviews.text: This works great. It’s lightweight and can be easily concealed and just barely bigger than a box of matches. If can Bluetooth the heck out of any device that has RVA inputs or RCA to mini audio 4.5mm audio cord. It has great range and can pick up my phone from the second story and does a good job recognizing multiple devices that have saved it. It’s well made and I recommend it. Turn that old Onkyo receiver up and get those Bose speakers kicking out 21 savage. That’s what the kids like.
customer_reviews.author: Brian L

customer_reviews.title: Wow, it's great!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and very enjoyable. The supplied 3.5mm to dual RCA plug cord caused a loud buzz in my system so I used a dedicated RCA patch cord instead. Perfect. The audio quality is pretty good, considering it's streaming which compresses and decompresses the audio signal with algorithms about 50 times. But for the electronica and ambient music I use this for it's just fine. So you can keep your vintage stereo system going by repurposing it. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: PD

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: I have a PC dedicated to my music library, and control it through my Fire tablet. I use these devices to plug into inputs on my receivers so my tablet can send the music to my full sized stereos. Works perfectly. There is no on/off switch, but I just plug them into the power outlets on the back of the receivers so they turn on automatically, whenever the receiver does. Good price, and effortless to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Q

customer_reviews.title: Unlock an old stereo's full capability! Modernly!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my parents that have a killer stereo system from the 1990's that has everything except Bluetooth. This little gem fixed that...Audio quality is still amazing, but now with a modern touch thanks to a quick and easy plug and play device. It has reasonable Bluetooth range and my parents love it, especially now being able to play music from their devices instead of just CD's.
customer_reviews.author: bzamora97

customer_reviews.title: Bought 3 of these so far
customer_reviews.text: I manage the facilities of a big health club and I have installed these on all of the stereos after apple stopped putting headphone jacks on their phones and everyone kept stealing my adapters. They work awesome! The only thing is sometimes they don't connect but you just go to forget this device and then they work fine again. I have two installed in rooms next to each other and absolutely no interference. If you are looking to upgrade your sound system to bluetooth easily, look no further.
customer_reviews.author: John Titor

customer_reviews.title: GOOD WORKING PRODUCT!!
customer_reviews.text: Just opened the box, plugged it in, connected it and paired it. Its working flawlessly compared to a competitors "best selling" product that would drop signal even if 2 feew from my phone in direct line of sight with no other bluetooth device enabled anywhere around it. it gives you the choice of using a 3.5mm mini headphone or standard left & right channel phono inputs. The only thing that is kind of different is that it has its own dedicated power supply (included, with about a 6 foot cord) connects with a mini-headphone style plug, its not like some others that have a micro-usb connection for power. Sound quality seems acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Sheephead Slayer

customer_reviews.title: Works with Intel NUC Windows 10 PC
customer_reviews.text: Just got this Logitech Bluetooth Audio Adapter today and had no problem getting it to work with my Intel NUC Windows 10 PC. Now music, video, game audio and PC sounds are played wirelessly to my Altec Lansing powered PC speakers, perfect! (Note my PC does have a built in Bluetooth transmitter, it will not work in your computer if you don't have built in Bluetooth or a separately purchased USB transmitter dongle attached!)
customer_reviews.author: C. Davidson

customer_reviews.title: My Bose Speaker System Gets New Life
customer_reviews.text: I have a great Bose speaker system that needed to connect to streaming music. I bought another Bluetooth receiver and it didn’t work very well. Disconnected constantly then was difficult to reconnect. I replaced that finicky Bluetooth receiver with this unit. No issues with disconnecting any more. Connects as soon as it sees my iPod again. It’s dedicated to the iPod for playing music in the house so I appreciate the rapid discovery. Great buy for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: K. Newcomb

customer_reviews.title: Bad purchase
customer_reviews.text: Works well for a while then shuts down and has to be reconnected for no apparent reason. Often out of the blue it quits and the only way I can get it to work again is by rebooting my computer. VERY aggravating indeed! It is about to end up in the trash along with another very expensive Logitech bluetooth headset and two roller ball mice that quit it short order.
customer_reviews.author: loren shelby

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I had this set up with a Samsung 5-speaker surround sound home stereo system. I mainly used for playing music on my phone, Spotify/SoundCloud/MixCloud/YouTube, watching movies on my smart tv. The signal sometimes would automatically try to reconnect even if I changed the bluetooth to another device. But it wasn't too bad. I would purchase this again. Wish it was a thinner device that would stay close to the surface.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Gamiao

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth range so good, it's almost annoying
customer_reviews.text: So I've bought two of these. One for an old stereo that I keep in the garage and one to feed music from my phone into my music studio in the basement. They sound great. They pair easily and connect more reliably than any bluetooth product I've ever owned. The connection is so solid that when I'm out in the yard, 200ft away, the connection to the Logitech adapter in my basement is stronger than the bluetooth earbuds on my head, right next to the phone. Unless I go inside and unplug the power to the adapter, I have to unpair it. Like I said, the connection is annoyingly good.
customer_reviews.author: Someone

customer_reviews.title: Audio Drops Echo Show
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice looking device. I purchases it so I can play music through my home theather 7.2 system. I have the rca going in through the front Aux input panel on my Onkyo TX-NR5009. When it works it's great, but the audio drops out all the time when connected to my Echo Show 20 feet away direct line of site. Also Echo Show does not support speaker groups when you connect a bluetooth speaker to it.
customer_reviews.author: jpsoutlook

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Echo Dot
customer_reviews.text: Got this to plug in behind my legacy stereo system so my echo dot could connect to it via BT. It works great, connecting automatically whenever the stereo is turned on. Note that the receiver has a switched outlet in the back, so this device is only receiving power when the receiver is on. This way, I get the Alexa output from the stereo speakers when the receiver is on, and it disconnects automatically and lets the dot use its native speaker when its off. Seamless.
customer_reviews.author: Firemonkey

customer_reviews.title: Great to add bluetooth to an old receiver
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to add bluetooth to my old receiver. I plugged the power into the rear switched receptacle so it only powers up when I turn on the receiver. It locks to my phone bluetooth within a few seconds and sounds awesome. I bought another one for a garage sounds system and that works great too. highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ira Hart

customer_reviews.title: It works perfectly — until it doesn’t.
customer_reviews.text: It’s the perfect solution. I gave it five stars until yesterday. I use it to send music from my Mac to my old stereo receiver (and of course I could also send the music from my iPhone.) But yesterday it just quit. No connect, no function, no lights, no nothing. I tried a different plug: no avail. I’m going to buy another one because I don’t know of anything that works as well for me — but it has definitely dropped down to three stars.
customer_reviews.author: DCD

customer_reviews.title: Nice Adapter
customer_reviews.text: Seamless, quick, small, and easy to use adapter. There is no "brain" inside this thing. It just connects your device to your speaker. If your device pings while you are watching a movie, for example, your speaker will ping. The adapter is a bridge not a filter. When operating, the base lights up and it emits a blue light. It is not annoying or distracting, but it is blue if that is an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Brody

customer_reviews.title: Saves $$$no need to uprade my home system
customer_reviews.text: I compared a lot of products before I bought this. Main reasons I bought this was 1...price is great 2...Logitech Name 3...Easy connecting I spent a lot of money on my Home Surround Sound System aprox $3000...It only a few years old. But it's not bluetoothed. This little Logitech box solved that in about 4 minutes. It allows for streaming my music thru my home System, And it sounds great!!! This is a great inexpensive way to solve the Bluetooth issue..
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Brown of Heber

customer_reviews.title: Its just OK
customer_reviews.text: I am giving this three stars as it has some good and some not so good features. I had almost returned it, but at this price I am sure any of them are going to have some issues. Pros: Does exactly what it should pipe Bluetooth audio to my receiver Has a nice rubber foot to keep it in place Cons: Not the best range Audio drops out or stops playing for a second or two quite often Quite intrusively reconnects to your phone/tablet every time your in range despite having been disconnected manually many, many times.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Great Bluetooth adapter!
customer_reviews.text: Have it now for more than a year with daily usage. Works great and basically con convert any audio system to a Bluetooth supporting one. This could connect to your old receiver which has large speakers, non BT car audio using a 3.5 Jack AUX input. Anything that has speakers and an AUX input but does not support streaming media from your phone or tablet or PC to it. Totally recommend this to any one in need for BT adapter!
customer_reviews.author: Itai Schweitzer

customer_reviews.title: It's a connection hog
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this works great, except the fact that it'll override any other bluetooth connection currently going. Using my headset while mowing the lawn and get close to the house...gotta stop and forget the logitech connection, reconnect to my headset, and restart the music. That really is annoying. Read other reviews, and you'll see it's a problem. Other than that, it's great
customer_reviews.author: Travis H

customer_reviews.title: Great Same Room Streaming
customer_reviews.text: Took about 5 seconds to set up - plugged it into an outlet and used the included connector to plug the RCA plugs into the device and the 3.5 audio plug into my switching box (with connects to my receivers Aux In). The device appeared immediately when I turned on my laptop's Bluetooth. The only reason for four stars is it wouldn't work in the adjacent room when it had to transmit through a wall - even though it was only about 15' away and if I walk between the device and my laptop it does cut out for a second.
customer_reviews.author: G. Carlin

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Currently use this adapter to connect to our outside speakers. Have used it a handful of times over the last few days. It seems to have good connectivity, although I wish the connectivity would cover my whole backyard. My backyard isn’t huge, it’s a standard city backyard. The sound is clear and the sound goes quiet high, so it fills my backyard and the sound travels far. Overall happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ashlee B

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Pro : Easy connectivity, strong connection and small footprint. Con: Why do all electronics manufacturers feel like they have to have a bright blue light? Price is really ridiculous but wanted "name brand".
customer_reviews.author: Mickey B

customer_reviews.title: Disrupts All Other Bluetooth Audio Devices
customer_reviews.text: Huge flaw. Disrupted all other Bluetooth audio device signals. This made all my other Bluetooth speakers throughout my house have choppy audio, even when this wasn’t even remotely connected to my phone. This happened for a few days until I realized it only had been happening since I set it up. I unplugged the device and all my other speakers worked clearly again. Also it’s very hard to disconnect from this device, you either have to forget it or completely turn off Bluetooth. I do not recommend this particular Bluetooth adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Drakyll

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little product.
customer_reviews.text: I have this installed in my garage connected to an old Bose lifestyle system that controls some outdoor speaker around my pool. The old lifestyle system didn't have bluetooth and couldn't connect to the internet. I was going to throw it away but thought I would give this a try to see if I could connect my phone to it. Sure enough, it worked perfectly. Makes my old Bose system useful again.
customer_reviews.author: F.A.B

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with it!
customer_reviews.text: I'm using it to play music from my iPhone 7 on our home stereo system. We have a Sony STR-DE197 receiver. Installation was incredibly simple. After turning on Bluetooth on my phone, my phone saw the device and paired immediately. The sound quality is excellent. So is it's range - I walked into another part of the house about 30 feet away, separated by a masonry chimney, and the connection was maintained.
customer_reviews.author: E. Meadows

customer_reviews.title: Breathes new life into vintage stereo for the garage
customer_reviews.text: Call me a procrastinator, bought this thing almost 3 years ago, just getting it hooked up. All I can say is WOW! Now I can stream music from my phone into my old 1980's era stereo in the garage with no issue and it sounds great! Hookup was no issue. I bought this unit because it was AC powered and it would connect using RCA jacks. Forgot to turn the stereo off last night and when I went out this morning, I heard the BT connect automatically. Simply hit play, and music was playing again. Love this thing! Overall, I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas C. Evans

customer_reviews.title: Almost to good!
customer_reviews.text: Great range! My home is 3 levels, right around 3100 sqf and the device is in the lower level on the complete other side as I am on the top floor and it’s picking up just fine! My stereo is 20 yrs old without BT but has an old Red/wht cd port, I had a red/wht cable, hooked it up and connected my iPhone and played music and I was super surprised it even worked and it sound great as well!
customer_reviews.author: Bee jay

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Bluetooth adapter!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product! It gave new life to my old stereo system. The sound quality is very good and the connectivity is good although It could use a little more range. It is nice not having to plug in audio cables all the time. My old stereo has a switched outlet where I have this plugged into. That works great to make sure the Bluetooth connection is off when I turn off the stereo.
customer_reviews.author: Midland98

customer_reviews.title: Pairs great with an Echo Dot
customer_reviews.text: This goes great with an Echo Dot. By plugging this in to your receiver, you can then connect the Echo Dot via Bluetooth. Normally, if you have your Echo Dot connected to your home receiver via wire, and wanted to ask the Echo a question while watching a movie, you'd need to manually switch inputs back to the Echo. By connecting via Bluetooth, you can tell the Echo to disconnect the Bluetooth and answer your question using the onboard speaker instead.
customer_reviews.author: George Eagle

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!
customer_reviews.text: This really came in handy! I didn't want to buy another Bluetooth speaker, this turned my current stereo speakers into Bluetooth! The only issue I have is that when changing the volume on my phone it doesn't actually lower until the volume is lower than 25%. But other than that I really enjoy using it! Saved me a lot of money because I didn't have to go spend $50+ on a Bluetooth speaker that doesn't have half the bass and my stereo speakers!
customer_reviews.author: Nina

customer_reviews.title: Flawless Pipeline from mobile device to home stereo
customer_reviews.text: Hookup was automatic and instant and home audio system was playing mobile phone music and apps immediately. Great value for money. Not sure if you can turn it "off" except with power plug; it aggressively takes up any bluetooth signal it finds....not always desirable if there are multiple devices in the vicinity. No way of know what's hooked up by looking at device. (no GUI).
customer_reviews.author: Daddio

customer_reviews.title: Hmmm
customer_reviews.text: Connected easily in about a minute and functioned well with no issues right out of the box. Couldn't have been any simpler to install. Has never dropped a connection in almost a year of use. We would prefer it to have a much smaller, less bright indicator light. A simple, small LED would have been less intrusive and saved energy. Good device at a reasonable cost.
customer_reviews.author: T Tass

customer_reviews.title: I’m on #2, but not because I wanted 2...
customer_reviews.text: When I first got this unit, I was extremely happy with it. It connects flawlessly and the sound quality is fine for my garage. That said, I’m on my second unit. The first one just died after about 2 months of use. The second one is still alive, so we will see...
customer_reviews.author: APersonWhoBoughtAThing

customer_reviews.title: I dislike the auto-connect feature
customer_reviews.text: The auto-connect is really annoying as it hijacks your phone's bluetooth connection if it's on. There are times when I'm using a different bluetooth speaker (garage, headset, shower) and if my phone comes into range, this takes over. My solution to make this usable was plugging the adapter into a cord with an in-line toggle switch. So, I just turn it on when I want it auto-connect and off when I'm done with it. Not the best, but not the worst.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonBuyer11

customer_reviews.title: Cannot be disconnected
customer_reviews.text: Just wanted to reiterate that if you have this adapter plugged in, you cannot use any other Bluetooth devices within its range, which is a serious flaw. You can disconnect it from your phone, but a couple seconds later, it will automatically reconnect, muscling aside other Bluetooth devices you are trying to connect to. There's no on-off button, so the only solution is to unplug it. I'm looking for an alternative. I would recommend this only if this adapter will be the only Bluetooth device you are using in your home.
customer_reviews.author: John Cochran

customer_reviews.title: Great connection but no digital output
customer_reviews.text: I have a quality ARCAM receiver so I want to use its DAC. But this bluetooth Audio adapter does not have a digital output. The built-in DAC cannot compare with my receiver DAC but my receiver is 100 times more expensive so it is not fair to compare the quality. I ended up returning this model and picked a model with a digital output. The bluetooth connection is decent and can stay connected to my ipad over 10 meters. The other bluetooth adapter does not have as good connection range.
customer_reviews.author: Alan V.

customer_reviews.title: Good little tool.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for a pretty long time now (3 years?). Works better than expected. There's not really a lose in quality like I was worried about. I will eventually upgrade to a newer Bluetooth version that uses less battery, but no hurry. Pairs easily and keeps pair info after being unplugged. The range is just kinda okay, but that's on Bluetooth. If you have a line-of-sight you'll be good, but it struggles through walls and I can't walk around the house with my phone in my pocket without the signal cutting out.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Works well and is a great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as advertised. Added Bluetooth access to my classic stereo system (read as old stereo system). Easy to pair and sounds great. Has a good look on top of my amp and perhaps the only thing I don’t like is the rather bright blue LED. But for the price I am willing to overlook that. A reliable brand makes for a worry free purchase, buy this and don’t look back!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony S. Zorn

customer_reviews.title: It works fine except if you want to stream music from Alexa to the Logitec audio bluetooth device.
customer_reviews.text: This blue tooth device won't stop connecting to Alexa. I bought this device to stream audio to my home sterio. I wanted it to connect to my phone bluetooth and Alexa's bluetooth. Pairing is flawless, and easy. The problem arises when connected to Alexa. It will not stay unconnected. Either by app or voice, if you disconnect the device from Alexa, it will immediately reconnects back to Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Was easy to set up and use for the first time. Nice that they include both kinds of cords so it will work depending on the device you're hooking to. Just like other people here said, the only thing I don't like is that it overpowers any other BT device you have in the house. You basically have to unplug this thing when you're not using it which is kind of a hassle. Either way, it turned my ancient home theater system into a BT machine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Used this to enable streaming music from my smart phone to my outdoor speakers. I later purchased an Echo Dot during prime days so I wouldn't have to use my phone to enjoy music. Repurposed this adapter in my car using an iPhone charger (same voltage as the included transformer, very low amperage draw) plugged into the cigarette lighter adapter and the 3.5 mm cable into my cars aux input. Syncs up with my phone as soon as I start the car.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Good Value & Works as Expected
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality and pairing ease is very good. Slight reduction in volume from paired device compared to other Bluetooth devices. As previously mentioned in another review, the device has no power switch and must be powered off to avoid unintentional pairing with active phones or pads. Easy solution is a switched outlet:
customer_reviews.author: zeetrade

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: This Logitech Bluetooth Audio Streaming device stopped working after 3 months. It worked fine for a while. But it lost volume. I have to turn amplifier volume all the way to get enough sound out of speakers. Very disappointed. Update: After unplugging and let it reset, it worked fine again for a while, then acted up again. It must be a lemon. Too late to return it to Amazon for refund now...
customer_reviews.author: Vermonter

customer_reviews.title: dirty insulation warehouse
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in 2014 and set it up with my old home stereo (old yamaha receiver with huge cerwin-vega speakers) at our dusty, hot, dirty insulation warehouse. The logitech stays on 24-7 due to its location and we use it daily and it has *never* had any issue with anything. My guys all connect to it, no one has connection issues. This cheapo little plastic gizmo had every right to konk out by now-especially in that environment, with daily use-but it just goes and goes...
customer_reviews.author: D. Crowe

customer_reviews.title: I've had it a year, and it still works great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this adapter so my wife could use her iPhone and Pandora with our old-school classic stereo. Not much to be said other than it works great, and continues to work! I just used the RCA inputs, and plugged it into the "tape player" inputs on the Sansui stereo receiver. I'd guess the optimal distance < 30 feet, but that is OK. Good product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: The_Owl

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic little device
customer_reviews.text: I'm not one to write reviews much, its a rarity for me to do so but this little device works great. I added Bluetooth functionality to the Sony stereo receiver that I got back in 1994. So far so good. set up was super easy with all the necessary cables included. Sound quality and connectivity are top-notch as well. The device is tiny as well, measuring in at 1"x1"x1/2" and you hardly know its there. Yes, I seldom write up reviews but since I like this item so much I thought of sharing my positive experience with it for 3 weeks since I got it.
customer_reviews.author: A.B.B.

customer_reviews.title: Unit failed after one week.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second unit. Good range throughout a 1500 square foothouse. Sound quality is completely acceptable. Unit worked well for one week then one channel failed. A day later the second channel failed. Hence the three stars. This appears to be a nice unit for the money, but the quality control in manufacturing is very poor. I have owned two and one failed. 50% reliability !!
customer_reviews.author: joe figueira

customer_reviews.title: This made my Crown Amplifier and Klipsch Speakers into a Bluetooth Stereo for my bedroom!!
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this item...I think it was about 22.00 usd...Amazing little gadget for my sound system...So awesome to turn an old amplifier and speakers into a GREAT SOUNDING Blue Tooth System...I can listen to my laptop, my Fire stick, and my cellphone...Excellent sound quality with YouTube, any other source material...Sooooo Happy with this little unit...!!
customer_reviews.author: Steve Weinstein

customer_reviews.title: Small but does the job
customer_reviews.text: Logitech makes good products. I have always been satisfied with their products. TheBluetooth Audio Adapter is small but does an excellent job of streaming internet programming. I had its predecessor which lasted about 5 years, so I look for this one to last several years, too. It is easy to set up and bluetooth devices connect easily and fast with a couple of clicks. I recommend it to anyone who wants to convert a non-bluetooth device to bluetooth capability.
customer_reviews.author: Tino

customer_reviews.title: I am more than happy with the quality of it
customer_reviews.text: I ordered some KRK studio monitors and wanted to listen to them wire-free so I did some research and found this product. I am more than happy with the quality of it, it provides very clean sound and pairs to your device within seconds unlike some other bluetooth devices. Attached is a picture of the setup, notice you probably can't see the bluetooth adapter very well because its taped to the back of the dresser and still works perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up, better sound than other units (generics)
customer_reviews.text: Set this up on my Harman Kardon stereo and it works flawlessly, I can say that I do listen to a lot more music now as it has made the hifi accessible to music from my phone, laptop and other devices. Sounds good. Design is plastic and a bit flimsy at that, also has a blue light that has no way to be programmed to turn off, which may be annoying to some. Personally, I am very pleased with the product and the Logitech brand has not let me down so far!
customer_reviews.author: JJ Braunius

customer_reviews.title: Great in Every Way!
customer_reviews.text: Got this to play music from my phone wirelessly to my vintage hi-fi. It was a breeze to set up and it sounds amazing. I especially love the sort of suction material on the bottom that keeps it from moving but doesn't require me to commit to any one position. And on top of all that, it's cost effective and looks great. Logitech did a top notch job on this one!
customer_reviews.author: Allan De Yong

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: Well this just arrived. I unboxed it 5 minutes ago and it is already working! Plugged it in to my audio system through the input I already had for the old iPod dock, connected via bluetooth, hit play on my iPhone X. Bingo! Music! While the Bluetooth format compresses the signal, I'm not expecting it to match the fidelity of my high-end CD's or vinyl.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Works, but the sound quality gets hampered.
customer_reviews.text: I have connected my harman kardon soundbar sb16 with this and it works on the bluetooth, but if I compare the sound quality when I used soundbar connected with wire VS connected with this device for bluetooth, then I am definitely experiencing impact on the base of the sound. Disconnected this bluetooth and reverified that nothing wrong with my harman kardon soundbar sb16 sound when it is wired, but since this bluetooth setting works I am still happy.
customer_reviews.author: Dhananjay

product_meta.title: Logitech Bluetooth Audio Adapter for Bluetooth Streaming
product_meta.description: Multipoint Bluetooth connectivity: simultaneously pair your smartphone and tablet and stream music from either one System Requirements: Computer speakers|Home stereo systems|AV receivers
feature_bullets: Bluetooth Audio Adapter: Makes your speakers Bluetooth for streaming music from your smartphone or tablet
Multipoint Bluetooth connectivity: Simultaneously pair your smartphone and tablet and stream music from either one
Easy pairing and automatic re pairing: Pair your device to the adapter once with a single button press and you're done
Long range wireless: Stream music from up to 15 meters (50 feet) away from your speakers
Works with most speakers: Plugs into any powered PC speakers, home stereo systems and A/V receivers using RCA or 3.5 mm jacks. This product is a receiver ONLY, not a transmitter.
